author: dtb_
content: basic question regarding sync committees via the altair spec. when the next sync committee is selected, it's possible for duplicate validator indices to exist if there is a small validator set of < 512 + 128. in practice, is there a situation where there would ever be a validator set that small, or is that just a general safety measure? put differently -- the active(?) validator set is around 250k right now, which would be the validator pool size the sync committee is being selected from...nothing close to the "small set" of 640 validators. just trying to understand the comment in this function: https://github.com/ethereum/annotated-spec/blob/master/altair/beacon-chain.md#get_sync_committee_indices

author: dtb_
content: the randomized selection process could result in dupes, but the whole committee size comment is throwing me off

author: jgm
content: Probability of duplicates is based off the total number of active validators, but it's always a possibility.

author: potuz
content: Yeah that comment is unfortunate, one thing about randomness is that no matter the committee size, as long as it's bigger than 1 we eventually expect to see duplicates
